title: Delayed LeaverBuster Penalties
body:
Hey all,

There were some firewall and networking issues recently and we decided to turn LeaverBuster off to ensure that players were not mistakenly sent to low priority queue. When the server issues were fixed, we turned LeaverBuster back on, but the penalties weren't firing. As a result of this, we're seeing that some players ***who left/AFK'd in games after the firewall and networking issues resolved*** did not receive their penalty until this week.

Sorry about the confusion! All low priority queue penalties should be granted immediately after leaving/AFK games now, instead of after a delay.

Hello everyone who is reading this.
Today, I have received probably my first penalty in five years of LoL.
That's right, I've been playing since preseason 1 now.
So what was the reason for that?
AFK.
Intentional? No. 
2 of the games I "left" were because I had a bugsplat and could not join the game anymore.
2 of the games were because my stepbrother caused blackouts.
I had a premade who told that to both teams, they were okay with it and did not report me.
But leaverbuster said no.
I received a 5 Game low priority queue, for reasons I had nothing to with at all.
I received a "penalty" because I was "afk", while I did everything I could to get back.
Riot, I really like your game, like many other players.
I oversaw many things, many indeed, random game-quits in season 1, serverdowns, freezes in championselect, and many more.
So why is it, that I have to sit in this queue, while I did nothing to actually deserve it?
Could you not do it like teamspeak does when a user gets a disconnect? "User in your channel timed out" ?
Could you not try things to improve that?
Or could you not deactivate leaverbuster completely and just let teams decide?
I really hope you soon find a better option than randomly letting leaverbuster decide who gets a penalty and who does not.

With kind regards,

Vanirgon.
